author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Meteora plays Library Coffeehouse
text:
Oct 23, 2015 Midcoast folk trio Meteora features, from left, Will Brown, Kat Logan and Jim Loney. 
Camden — The Camden Library Coffeehouse continues its series of fine concerts with musicians from near and far. Meteora will be the featured band Thursday, Nov. 5, at 7 p.m. at the downtown library. Admission is $7, and refreshments will be available. 
Meteora plays an eclectic array of original songs and folk ballads, as well as traditional tunes, songs, and original arrangements. Tight three-part harmonies and varied arrangements are Meteora’s signature. 
Kat Logan and Jim Loney are a singer/songwriter couple from Friendship. Logan has a clear, inviting voice and plays piano, accordion, banjo and guitar. She has performed folk, country and blues music throughout New England for the past 20 years. Loney plays guitar, banjo and hand percussion, He has performed Delta blues and R&B for many years, as well as Cuban son music, which he played with Primo Cubano. 
The trio is completed by Will Brown of Lincolnville, who has been playing and singing folk music in concerts since his teens. Brown plays guitar, laud, banjo and frame drum percussion, with occasional sprints on the cornet. He has been recording with Gordon Bok, Cindy Kallet, Grey Larsen and Anne Dodson for three decades. Logan also has recorded with Bok, and both Brown and Logan recorded songs for the 2009 Grammy-nominated album “Singing Through The Hard Times – A Tribute to Utah Phillips.” 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com. Meteora
